summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have conspired with Ghislaine Maxwell to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14 from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release announcing Maxwell's arrest and charges, and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement in the press release praising the victims' bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and partners for seeking justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, transport, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein and with perjury.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition and Alleged Perjury
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell testified under oath in a civil proceeding and is charged with making repeated false statements during this deposition.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse scheme operated from at least 1994 to 1997, targeting girls as young as 14.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for allegedly making false statements during a sworn deposition in 2016.
The alleged grooming and abuse occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery in coming forward.
